posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: October 19, 2017 at 3:06 PM#4Fixture 1 is doing something, and you want Fixture 2 to do the same thing that Fixture 1 is doing?Fixture 2 At Fixture 1There are of course ways to limit which attributes this applies to as well, such as:- Holding the [At] key and defining a filter- Calling a filter that you've already defined- Using "If" (for example, adding "If Presettype 4" to the end of the syntax above would only copy over the color attributes.Is that what you were looking for?

posts.author: clear_all
posts.post_text: October 19, 2017 at 10:12 PM#5I think he's looking for a single button "at previous fixture" command.Currently my workaround for that is ugly as hell, but works:1: Previous2: store /o group 9993: Next4: at group 999I'm not proud of it, but it's held up fairly well so far.
